meanings.definition: To split or divide into two parts
meanings.sent1: I will dich the cake into two equal pieces.
meanings.sent2: She diched the paper in half to share with her friend.
meanings.sent3: The magician will dich the scarf into two separate colors!
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to dich the forest, creating a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The sharp knife easily diched the apple into perfect halves.

meanings.definition: A division or contrast between two things
meanings.sent1: The dich between night and day is clear.
meanings.sent2: There is a noticeable dich between the two teams' strategies.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show highlighted the dich between casual and formal wear.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting beautifully captured the dich of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The book explores the emotional dich between love and hate.
